channel.title: Simpleblah Forum Software - NEW - Need a team to finish project
channel.description:
[size=14pt][b]Simpleblah Forum Software[/b][/size] For a few years I have been working on a forum software from scratch. Now it is time that I start up a team to help develop the software. I was planning on finishing it myself and releasing a fully complete version then starting a team. But obviously that is taking me way to long to complete. Some pages are not fully skinned yet. The admincp is not complete.
[b]Missing features:[/b] Sticky threads Usergroups Members list Online users locations A working Admin CP Showing the last edit time of a post A better Smiley/BBCode system [i]... There are a few others that I will not point out at this time. [/i]
[b]The Team[/b] bjc22 (me)
Current version of the software that needs to be worked on: 0.0.1
Download it here: [url=http://www.simpleblah.com/software/001.zip]http://www.simpleblah.com/software/001.zip[/url]
[b]HOW TO INSTALL:[/b] - Unzip the zip file and upload the contents to your web server - Make a table called simpleblah and upload simpleblah.sql which is inside the zip folder to the sql server through phpmyadmin. - If the table name has to be different from simpleblah, change it in the BJC_Config.php file. - The username and password of the already made account is: username: admin password: admin
This is the first release. When I add new versions I will show the updated code for each release. If you submit code to the project you will be credited in the source code.
[b]LINKS:[/b]
[url=http://www.simpleblah.com/forums/]http://www.simpleblah.com/forums/[/url] - The current main testing/team development forum [url=http://www.simpleblah.com/software/001.zip]http://www.simpleblah.com/software/001.zip[/url] - Simpleblah Forum 0.0.1 download

I did use it for things like displaying errors and logging in and registering but I didn’t go crazy with it. Join my development team.

item.title: Simpleblah Forum Software - NEW - Need a team to finish project
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

Of course, it’s how all the professionals do it!

Heh that was in 2008 when I was first learning PHP. Then sometime in 2009 I started over again when I knew a lot more with PHP. Then I kept getting more knowledge and kept replacing my code with better code, which is why it took me forever. If you want you can download my source and check it out for yourself.

And actually what you quoted was me asking how I would order the topics by the latest post instead of the latest topic.

Read full topic
item.source: Simpleblah Forum Software - NEW - Need a team to finish project

item.title: Simpleblah Forum Software - NEW - Need a team to finish project
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“bjc22”]My Unanswered Questions:

  1. How do I order the topics by last date posted in?
  2. Why does the date on my website change when I change the clock on my computer, even though the timezone is set to EST?[/quote]

I’m sorry but, are you fucking serious? You expect to make forum software without knowing how to use the ORDER keyword in a sql query???

Read full topic

item.title: Simpleblah Forum Software - NEW - Need a team to finish project
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

[size=14pt]Simpleblah Forum Software[/size]
For a few years I have been working on a forum software from scratch. Now it is time that I start up a team to help develop the software. I was planning on finishing it myself and releasing a fully complete version then starting a team. But obviously that is taking me way to long to complete. Some pages are not fully skinned yet. The admincp is not complete.

Missing features:
Sticky threads
Usergroups
Members list
Online users locations
A working Admin CP
Showing the last edit time of a post
A better Smiley/BBCode system
… There are a few others that I will not point out at this time.

The Team
bjc22 (me)

Current version of the software that needs to be worked on: 0.0.1

Download it here: http://www.simpleblah.com/software/001.zip

HOW TO INSTALL:

  • Unzip the zip file and upload the contents to your web server
  • Make a table called simpleblah and upload simpleblah.sql which is inside the zip folder to the sql server through phpmyadmin.
  • If the table name has to be different from simpleblah, change it in the BJC_Config.php file.
  • The username and password of the already made account is:
    username: admin
    password: admin

This is the first release. When I add new versions I will show the updated code for each release. If you submit code to the project you will be credited in the source code.

LINKS:

http://www.simpleblah.com/forums/ - The current main testing/team development forum
http://www.simpleblah.com/software/001.zip - Simpleblah Forum 0.0.1 download
